title: Album Page, "Color Box", after 1886
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, above color grid (written on ruled lines): Color Box; upper right corner of sheet (perpendicular to color grid): 84; bottom right corner (perpendicular to color grid): 71; colors in grid, first row, beginning at left: ultramarine / indigo / ochre jaune / sienne bruli / noir de ... / cendre vert; second row, at left: cendre blue / paynes grey / jaune indium / g... gutta / vermilion; third row, at left: what.. / sepia / blue de Prusse / ca....
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding depicting three rows of rectangular patches of watercolor arranged into six columns, inscribed by graphite lines, creating a painter's palette complete with inscriptions of the various colors represented, including: ultramarine, indigo, vermilion, sepia, and Prussian blue.  These same colors are used throughout the watercolors in Warren's sketches.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Color Box", after 1886.Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-244.
